summary: Aegon Targaryen Jon Snow and Family Tree
title: Aegon Targaryen Jon Snow and Family Tree
body:
Aegon Targaryen Jon Snow and Family Tree

Aegon Targaryen

Lyanna Stark was the mother of Aegon Targaryen. And Prince Rhaegar Targaryen was the father of Aegon Targaryen, Aegon was the first and only child to Lyanna and Rhaegar. Prince Rhaegar Targaryen was the elder son of King Aerys ll, Rhaegar Targaryen siblings names are Daenerys Targaryen, Viserys Targaryen.

Aegon Targaryen mother was died after his birth in short time and his father…

tags: A Song of Ice and Fire
body: Throwback: Daenerys Targaryen

summary: Would have you want Sansa to accept the role of the queen in s7? And will be this issue brought back the next season?
question: Would have you want Sansa to accept the role of the queen in s7? And will be this issue brought back the next season?
answer:
I definitely think it would have been interesting if she did, far more interesting than arguing with Arya. I do think it will be brought up again S8. The Northern Lords were disappointed with Jon for leaving immediately after he was crowned so I can only imagine their anger when he tells them that he knelt to Dany. I do think that one of Sansa’s tasks is keeping them happy without deferring to Dany or taking the crown for herself because to her Jon will still be king (and the lords and ladies will probably be very unhappy and some might possibly leave if she accepts a Targaryen ruler) which will probably be complicated once Bran tells her about Jon’s parents. I doubt Sansa will ever back Dany so Sansa will employ every trick Littlefinger and Cersei taught her to keep the power firmly in House Stark’s corner, keep Dany happy without giving her any power and make sure no one learns of Jon’s real parents until it’s the right time. All while making sure the North is prepared for the Night King which will include handling any influxes of people from castles and villages closer to the Wall.

In other words Sansa would be acting as queen while refusing the crown.

summary: That's so weird to me, that Dany is put in the same category as Arya. Dany is very feminine coded if you ask me. Her only...
question: That's so weird to me, that Dany is put in the same category as Arya. Dany is very feminine coded if you ask me. Her only "weapon" is her dragons. She doesn't fight, she wears dresses, has her hair always done and nice, she's very womanly, she's more like Sansa or Margaery really. This fandom is so dumb tbh, they say Sansa didn't win the botb because "she didn't fight, the Vale did" but then say Dany is like Arya, even though she doesn't fight and uses dragons. Just like Sansa used her army.
answer: Some people want to take away Sansa’s win in BoTB because they know Jon being crowned over her makes no sense but whatever. Dany actively goes to war multiple times which again is enough for her to be seen as more masculine than feminine. I also think the Hollywood’s ideal action girl plays a part in which you have a female character engaged in war/knows how to fight and she also has to look impeccable the entire time which how one would describe Dany.

reblog.comment: Some people want to take away Sansa’s win in BoTB because they know Jon being crowned over her makes no sense but whatever. I also think the Hollywood’s ideal action girl plays a part in which you have a female character engaged in war/knows how to fight and she also has to look impeccable the entire time which how one would describe Dany.

summary: I still see that awful ‘Sansa the bully’ comic once in a while. Sadly it isn’t the only ‘mean bully Sansa’ piece out there....
question: I still see that awful ‘Sansa the bully’ comic once in a while. Sadly it isn’t the only ‘mean bully Sansa’ piece out there. Makes me want to see a comic in which Arya is telling Sansa she doesn’t want to do stupid boring embroidery with her, trowing the hoop away and leaving a very sad Sansa behind. That could totally happen in canon right? Just to see how angry the stans would get about their fave being portrayed negatively. Even if it probably never would happen in canon.
answer: That artist was pretending not to understand why everyone was upset. Anyway the scenario you described is more canon than what that person drew

reblog.comment: That artist was pretending not to understand why everyone was upset. Anyway the scenario you described is more canon than what that person drew

trail.content_raw: That artist was pretending not to understand why everyone was upset. Anyway the scenario you described is more canon than what that person drew
trail.content: That artist was pretending not to understand why everyone was upset. Anyway the scenario you described is more canon than what that person drew
